challengeName: Hercules OnCampus Beta Web - Errors when running on Heroku
detailedRequirements:
Overview

The OnCampus Beta application is a new version of the OnCampus HTML website, including the backend services and new HTML. The services are built in Java and hosted in DropWizard for easy deployment and testing. The services are reasonably complete, but we need to tweak them to match the requirements of the UI

Code

The existing code is here:

https://gitlab.com/team-autobots/OnCampus-Beta-Web

We are targeting Dropwizard for the deployment

If you need code access, please request in the forum for the TopCoder F2F challenge with your Gitlab username. You will be given read-only access. Note that the challenge forum is *not* a public forum or the general development forum. It is the forum specifically associated with this F2F challenge.

If you receive a 404 error when hitting the Gitlab link, it means you do NOT have access. Please request access in the challenge forum. Within 24 hours you will receive an email from Gitlab that states you have access. This is NOT an automatic process - it is handled manually.

Please ask any questions in the TopCoder forum or on Gitlab. Either is appropriate.

API documentation

The API documentation is available here: http://docs.oncampusrestapi.apiary.io
This contains the final format we will be targeting for the services. It may change as we test and add in things necessary for the final UI.

Base Java updates

You can make changes to the base Java libraries, with these requirements:
  • Provide two separate patch files - one for the libraries, and one for the services
  • Make sure the unit tests pass and cover the newly updated or added code

Dropwizard

We are using Dropwizard with deployment to Heroku for the development of the services. Please ensure your submission matches the layout here: http://www.dropwizard.io/manual/core.html#organizing-your-project We also want to ensure that all responses are built using POJOs and not using direct JSON manipulation. This will help with adding / removing fields in the future and ensuring that the services are maintainable. You are responsible for doing a good job at keeping your code consistent with what is already implemented! Consistency is important, as is using the features available in Dropwizard.

Heroku

Don't do anything to break Heroku compatibility. Your submission will be pushed to Heroku for testing, so it would make sense to do that before submitting.

Submission

Your submission to OR should be a Git patch file that can be applied to see the fixes. Here is documentation on how to generate a Git patch file:

https://ariejan.net/2009/10/26/how-to-create-and-apply-a-patch-with-git/

NOTE: In addition to a patch file, you must *also* provide a README with sample curl calls to cover all permutations of the API added, showing all parameters.

Ticket

The ticket is on Gitlab here:

https://gitlab.com/team-autobots/OnCampus-Beta-Web/issues/54
